verses.verse: To the chief Musician<WH5329>, A Psalm<WH4210> of David<WH1732>. The king<WH4428> shall joy<WH8055> in thy strength<WH5797>, O LORD<WH3068>; and in thy salvation<WH3444> how greatly<WH3966> shall he rejoice<WH1523>!
Thou hast given<WH5414> him his heart's<WH3820> desire<WH8378>, and hast not withholden<WH4513> the request<WH782> of his lips<WH8193>. Selah<WH5542>.
For thou preventest<WH6923> him with the blessings<WH1293> of goodness<WH2896>: thou settest<WH7896> a crown<WH5850> of pure gold<WH6337> on his head<WH7218>.
He asked<WH7592> life<WH2416> of thee, and thou gavest<WH5414> it him, even length<WH753> of days<WH3117> for ever<WH5769> and ever<WH5703>.
His glory<WH3519> is great<WH1419> in thy salvation<WH3444>: honour<WH1935> and majesty<WH1926> hast thou laid<WH7737> upon him.

For thou hast made<WH7896> him most blessed<WH1293> for ever<WH5703>: thou hast made<WH2302> him exceeding glad<WH8057> with thy countenance<WH6440>. made him most: Heb. set him to be blessings made him exceeding: Heb. make him glad with joy
For the king<WH4428> trusteth<WH982> in the LORD<WH3068>, and through the mercy<WH2617> of the most High<WH5945> he shall not be moved<WH4131>.
Thine hand<WH3027> shall find out<WH4672> all thine enemies<WH341>: thy right hand<WH3225> shall find out<WH4672> those that hate<WH8130> thee.

Thou shalt make<WH7896> them as a fiery<WH784> oven<WH8574> in the time<WH6256> of thine anger<WH6440>: the LORD<WH3068> shall swallow them up<WH1104> in his wrath<WH639>, and the fire<WH784> shall devour<WH398> them.
Their fruit<WH6529> shalt thou destroy<WH6> from the earth<WH776>, and their seed<WH2233> from among the children<WH1121> of men<WH120>.
For they intended<WH5186> evil<WH7451> against thee: they imagined<WH2803> a mischievous device<WH4209>, which they are not able<WH3201> to perform.

Therefore shalt thou make<WH7896> them turn their back<WH7926>, when thou shalt make ready<WH3559> thine arrows upon thy strings<WH4340> against the face<WH6440> of them. shalt thou: or, thou shalt set them as a butt back: Heb. shoulder
Be thou exalted<WH7311>, LORD<WH3068>, in thine own strength<WH5797>: so will we sing<WH7891> and praise<WH2167> thy power<WH1369>.
